Major Divisions of Books


 
Getting Started with Caché Basic, but important, information for Caché, the high-performance object database. Includes an introduction to Caché, release notes, upgrade checklist, installation guides, and a list of supported platforms.
 
Caché System Administration How to set up and maintain Caché. Topics include basic system administration, system monitoring, security, distributed data management (ECP), and high availability.
 
Caché Tools and Utilities How to use Caché development and administrative tools, including Caché Studio and this online documentation.
 
Technical Articles A collection of technical articles on various topics of interest.
 
PDF File Cross-Reference PDF File Cross-Reference
 

Getting Started with Caché

 
Introduction to Caché Provides an overview of the features and major components of Caché.
 
Supported Platforms Lists the platforms supported by this release of Caché, Ensemble, and HealthShare
 
Caché Release Notes Lists new features in recent Caché releases.
 
Caché Upgrade Checklists Discusses important topics to consider in moving systems to specific Caché releases.
 
Caché Installation Guide Describes the process of installing Caché on your system.
 
Using InterSystems Documentation Provides an overview of InterSystems product documentation.
 
InterSystems Copyright and Trademark Information Describes copyright information for content that appears in InterSystems products.
 

Caché System Administration

 
Caché System Administration Guide Introduces common system administration tasks.
 

Caché Tools and Utilities

 
Using Caché Terminal Describes how to use the Caché command-line interface.
 

Technical Articles By Subject Area


General
  • Adding UNIX Installation Packages to a Caché Distribution
    Explains how to add a new UNIX install package to an existing Caché distribution

  • Caché Windows Silent Installation
    Instructs programmers how to perform a silent installation/upgrade/reinstallation/removal of Caché on Windows.

  • Using the Caché %Installer Class
    Instructions about how to use the %Installer class to create a class defining an installation manifest which can be executed via a class method.


National Language Support
  • System Classes for National Language Support
    Provides an introduction to new NLS classes.


Third-party Tools and Porting
  • Caché Integration with a Network Appliance Filer
    Summarizes how to use Caché with database and log files stored on a NetApp filer.


Tools and Utilities
  • Caché Switches
    Discusses the available Caché switches, which are per-instance flags that can be used for a variety of purposes.

  • The Character-based (CHUI) Management Routines
    Describes the character-based routines available for managing Caché.

  • Using cvendian to Convert Between Big-endian and Little-endian Systems
    Discusses how to use the Caché cvendian utility to convert the byte order of a database.

  • Using the Caché ^%ZSTART and ^%ZSTOP Routines
    Discusses the basics of using the ^%ZStart and ^%ZStop routines.

  • Using the Caché ^GBLOCKCOPY Routine
    Describes the basics of running ^GBLOCKCOPY to copy globals.

PDF File Cross-Reference


  • ACHUI_Mgmt - The Character-based (CHUI) Management Routines

  • ACSW_Switches - Caché Switches

  • ACVE_UsingCVEndian - Using cvendian to Convert Between Big-endian and Little-endian Systems

  • AGBC_Gblockcopy - Using the Caché ^GBLOCKCOPY Routine

  • AINST_Installer - Using the Caché %Installer Class

  • ANAI_NetApp_Integration - Caché Integration with a Network Appliance Filer

  • ANLS_Classes - System Classes for National Language Support

  • AUIP_Adding_UNIX_Install_Pkg_to_Cache - Adding UNIX Installation Packages to a Caché Distribution

  • AWSI_Win_Silent_Install - Caché Windows Silent Installation

  • AZSS_ZStartZStop - Using the Caché ^%ZSTART and ^%ZSTOP Routines

  • GCNV - Caché Upgrade Checklists

  • GCRN - Caché Release Notes
